result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamella A Hurdle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Use Shielding Device (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jamella A Hurdle in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for 8:30 this morning. Discussions as to late appearance placed on the record. Court admonished defendant. Defense requests case set for Plea and Sentence date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jamella A Hurdle in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel would like time work on resolving this matter with a DPA.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing scheduled on August 24, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 24.

Defendant Jamella A Hurdle in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pretrial conference conducted.  Parties have reached a resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BAYSHORE TOWN CENTER (ENTIRE MALL) AND ANY SPORTS AUTHORITY STORE IN WISCONSIN.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jamella A Hurdle in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Defendant Jamella A Hurdle in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
